q: George W Bush as "a far more formidable president than his popular image", he also suggests the former president was at fault for not doing more to resolve disagreements among senior advisers. Mr Bush did not always receive, and may not have insisted on, a timely consideration of his options before he made a decision, nor did he always receive effective implementation of the decisions he made, Mr Donald Rumsfeld writes. "There were far too many hands on the steering wheel," he writes elsewhere; it was "a formula for running the truck into a ditch". Regrets

executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. "We've got very complicated government issues," he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google Inc. search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.

Tenet a memo saying that "we might be missing an opportunity" and wondering if more troops were needed. Donald Rumsfeld alleges that he later learned a CIA agent on the ground had requested just that but adds: I never received such a request from either Tommy Franks or Tenet. And can not imagine denying it if I had. If someone thought Osama bin Laden was cornered, as later claimed, I found it surprising that Tenet had never called me to urge Tommy Franks to support their operation. Donald Rumsfeld 's explanation? "Their recollections may be imperfect." its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. to the openness of the Web. The Beeb confronted Eric Schmidt with Google's apparent failure to catch the social network wave, citing the failure of Google Buzz. Eric Schmidt concedes that Google has been late adding social capabilities to our core products but says that Buzz and other current plans are not an attempt to copy Facebook.
